instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to measure the moisture content of Daqu during the fermentation process?
Output: Near-infrared hyperspectral imaging technique was used in the related study.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to enhance the spectral data in the related study to measure the moisture content of Daqu during the fermentation process?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to enhance the spectral data in the related study to measure the moisture content of Daqu during the fermentation process were the Savitzky–Golay (SG) filter and the standard normalized variate (SNV) method.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the detection method, and how far can this metric go in predicting the moisture content of Daqu?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the detection method is the coefficient of determination (R2) and the root mean square error (RMSE). The study results showed that the coefficient of determination (R2) of the prediction set reached 0.9977, indicating a high level of accuracy in predicting the moisture content of Daqu. Additionally, the root mean square error (RMSE) of the prediction set was 0.0021, which further demonstrates the precision of the detection method.

instruction: What improvements were made to enhance the accuracy of measuring moisture content in Daqu using a near-infrared hyperspectral imaging technique?
Output: Two improvements were made to enhance the accuracy of measuring moisture content in Daqu using a near-infrared hyperspectral imaging technique. The first improvement was the establishment of a multigranularity cascade forest model with various scanning window combinations to solve the problem of distribution offset in the prediction results. This helped improve the detection accuracy. The second improvement was the implementation of continuum removal processing to obtain enhanced spectral data from the sample spectral data. This further enhanced the accuracy of measuring the moisture content in Daqu.

instruction: How does the multigranularity cascade forest algorithm compare to traditional methods in terms of accuracy for measuring the moisture content of Daqu during the fermentation process using a near-infrared hyperspectral imaging technique?
Output: The multigranularity cascade forest algorithm was found to be markedly better than traditional methods such as support vector machine and backpropagation neural network in terms of accuracy for measuring the moisture content of Daqu during the fermentation process using a near-infrared hyperspectral imaging technique. The coefficient of determination of the prediction set (R2) and root mean square error of the prediction set reached 0.9977 and 0.0021, respectively. This indicates that the multigranularity cascade forest algorithm achieved highly accurate detection and distribution visualization of the moisture content of Daqu.
